intro: Alsodeiopsis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of linear, succulent leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Europe and North Africa, it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is drought-tolerant and often found in coastal dunes or rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
